Description: Shallow white Egyptian calcite footed bowl; the stone is bored and polished; the bowl has vertical, slightly concave walls with pronounced flanges at the rim and base; the bowl stands on a separately made pedestal foot, with concave sides and a splaying base.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hala Sultan Tekke, Tomb II
Bibliographic references: Bailey 1976 / Hala Sultan Tekke I. Excavations 1897-1971 (p.10, pl. IVd)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 27)
